intro: Cayaponia biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered cayaponia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate and have a hairy texture, while its stems are woody and branched. Cayaponia biflora is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories.
